Blog.post: I've finally found someone who loves shopping more than me. Neil! Although I am very very mad at him because he bought the exact same pair of shoes that I got a week ago. Heh, no he didn't buy women's shoes I bought men's shoes, btw. Chuck Taylor All-Stars in black. Mine have hot pink laces from Hot Topic so...so there!

Wing Chun, who runs twop with her husband Glark and their friend Sars, wrote a "Bad Teen Novel" that was first serialized at her website- hissyfit.com- and then published. I was too lazy when I was a kid to write a whole novel so now I present to you my very own "Bad Pre-Teen Short Story" My comments are in bold Timmy and Katherine By Katie Setting: A romantic restaurant in Washington D.C. The candlelight is burning down on 18 year old Katherine Ow the candlelight is burning down on me! Ouch! And 19 year old Timothy's Aah I see now that we're so old he's "Timothy" and I'm "Katherine" table which is in a very private corner. The boyfriend and girlfriend have just finished their ridiculously expensive shrimp scampi. Where did that come from? I'm allergic to fish! A waitress is bringing a beautiful heart�shaped tart What is a tart anyway? Something in the middle of the dessert glimmers and catches Katherine's eye. (By this time the waitress has left) She slowly realizes that it's a beautiful diamond ring Okay 1) Is this an exercise on how many times you can use beautiful in a story and 2) How the hell did "Timothy" manage to afford a diamond ring? Katherine looks into Timothy's soulful eyes Well that's the most retarded thing I've ever read and the band starts playing "I Need You Tonight" by the Backstreet Boys Oh. My. God. The candle completely burns out and he whispers "Well will you?" to which Katherine replies "Oh Timothy how could I not marry you? You're the love of my life. I've loved you since the day I first saw you Heh, even though I thought your name was Jeffery (a waiter comes and lights another flickering candle) Timothy slowly slides the ring onto Katherine's slender finger Sssssssweet! I bet he has sweaty skanky palms. He then pushes her hair, which hangs in ringlets Urmmm my hair is stick-straight away from her face and gently kisses her perfect lips Oh look at me and my perfect lips! I'm gonna go out on the town with my perfect lips! Whoohoo! and whispers, "let's go outside" into her ear That's kinda gross As soon as they leave the restaurant a horse-drawn carriage Oh sweet sassin' frassin' pulls up next to them. The driver gets out and lays down a red carpet leading up to the seat Red carpet? Whaaaaaa? "After you" says Timothy Aww he's such a gentleman Katherine sits down and smooths her silky smooth dress Heh smooths her silky smooth dress. Did I mention that it was smooth? Smooooooth Timothy sits next to her and she lays her head on his strong shoulder, Remember Timmy? He was kinda scrawny. I wouldn't pin him for the strong shoulder type they wrap their arms around each other and the carriage starts moving. Trotting past the dimly lit monuments.[sic] The driver drops them off by Timothy's car after they have cuddled for an hour Excuse me while I go throw up They drive to Katherine's house where they announce their engagement. As Katherine tells her parents Ok that's something I'd like to see. Can you imagine my dad? Hee! Her eyes fill with tears which Timothy lovingly brushes away Ick ick ick ick ick ick. Gross! Get your hands away from my eyes Timothy! Three Years Later That's right.....there's more Setting: Diane and Corrine These are Timmy's sisters by the way and Kelley are helping Katherine get ready for her and Timothy's wedding. They have had such a long engagement because Katherine's parents thought that they were too young to get married Ya think? But Timothy waited for her and now the big day has come. Corrine could hardly keep the 21 year old down to do her hair because Katherine was so excited. I don't know if I would be "excited" to marry Timmy. More like I would have to be very very drugged up She has been waiting for this day since she was 10 and everything had to be perfect. But did she look �beautiful'? Kelley was Katherine's Maid of Honor Woo go Kelley! And Diane and Corrine Schwartz were the bridesmaids. Katherine's 11 year old cousin Annika Ball Oooh even my cousin is in this! Was serving as Junior Bridesmaid. As Katherine peeked out of the tiny bridal room at BCC Wouldn't I be getting married in Illinois? the opening chords of the song the bridesmaids were to walk down to the aisle to. I wonder if it was by the Backstreet Boys? "You guys better go out there" Katherine says to her best friend and soons to be sister-in-law. "You too Katie, you're our following act" said Kelley Hey look she still refuses to call me Katherine! As they file out the door Katherine sees her father waiting to walk her down the aisle. Katherine watches as all the bridesmaids walk towards Timothy who is waiting for her at the altar. Katherine links arms with her father Who if I know him is bawling his eyes out by now and looks up into his dark face. "Dad, this is really happening" she says as she beams up at him He now has a heart attack probably "You really want to go through with this, honey? he asks her. "Of course I do, Dad, I love Timothy You know what "Katherine"? Shut the Hell up. "Well good because it's about that time" I think that line is from a movie Katherine listens as the organ There is no organ at BCC, is there? begins to play "Here Comes the Bride" Aww man I wanted to walk down the aisle to "I Want it That Way" "Well here goes nothing, Dad." Katherine whispers as they start to walk down the aisle. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ I have to go remove my brain from my skull and slap it silly for ever writing this.

You know you shop too much when your brother links to your blog by calling it Confessions Of a Shopaholic which just happens to be the name of a book that you read, but he's never seen the book. The sentence made no sense but I'm too lazy to fix it
Neil's playing Of Montreal. I think I might have to shoot myself. Sometimes I look at my profile on twop and I wonder how I've made 1257 posts since May
Hard-Boiled (John Woo film) = best action ever.
Oh but how quickly I forget that I'm already married!
It's official. I must marry Jason from Big Brother 3

I am on a lonely road and I am traveling Traveling, traveling, traveling Looking for something, what can it be Oh I hate you some, I hate you some I love you some Oh I love you when I forget about me I want to be strong I want to laugh along I want to belong to the living Alive, alive, I want to get up and jive I want to wreck my stockings in some juke box dive Do you want - do you want - do you want To dance with me baby Do you want to take a chance On maybe finding some sweet romance with me baby Well, come on All I Want--Joni Mitchell Am I the only 14 year old on the planet with Joni love?

Kelley, darling, how long have I been telling you to stay away from guys? That right, since the fourth grade and that guy- what was his name?- oh yeah, Dani. Just stay away from Brent and Brayden. You don't need a boyfriend right now. To quote Gloria Steinem- "I need a man like a fish needs a bicycle" What's the point? Dating is trying to find the man you're supposed to marry, no matter how much you tell yourself it's to have fun. That's the purpose of dating, Kell. You don't want to look back on your life and regret the things you did when you were 14. I don't want to sound all preachy or anything but you're messing yourself up and setting yourself up for disaster. If I hear that you've got yourself a new boyfriend I will hop a plane to OK and whap you on the head. And don't think I won't :) Nail Polish Color Of the Moment: First Dance
Dupont Circle is the devil

I just watched On the Waterfront . Loved. It. That was due in no small part to my crush on young Marlon Brando. Noel's horrible. He just made me a big sign that says "Hows About Them Cramps" *sigh* brothers.

Aww Kelley wrote the sweetest thing about me in her blog. I seriously cried when I read it. And yes, Kelley, I do know the real you. I know your inner dork. Unleash your inner nerd Kelley! You know you want to! Someday I will visit you and meet all your vapid "friends" and I will reveal who you really are to them. Don't think I won't because I will. Or better yet, come visit me and we can be dorks together.

The Beatles- I Will Billy Joel- Only the Good Die Young Brandy- Have You Ever Christina Aguilera- I Turn To You Jessica Simpson- Where You Are M2M- Don't Say You Love Me Mandy Moore- Candy 9 Days- Absolutely No Doubt- Ex Girlfriend Sting- Desert Rose Sugar Ray- Falls Apart Vitamin C- Graduation Aerosmith- Pink Foo Fighters- Everlong (acoustic) Goo Goo Dolls- Iris Jewel- You Were Meant For Me Madonna- American Pie Madonna Beautiful Stranger Right now I like about 3 of those songs. Well at least there was no Backstreet Boys.

Jeez, Mom and Noel go out driving and everyone calls. Leave me alone people! I'm trying to listen to some Etta James here! Don't they understand? I got a Frank Sinatra cd at the library, Frank Sinatra rules. I better not tell that to Kelley- she'd think I'm even more of a freak. Last night Mom was doing laundry and the only thing in my pajama drawer was my old Backstreet Boys t-shirt. I had to face my demons last night and it wasn't pretty. I put it on and instantly ugly memories flashed into my mind. Backstreet Boys concert with Kelley. Dancing to Britney Spears with Kelley. Writing a story entitled "Timmy and Katherine" all about me marrying a guy from our church. Shopping at Limited Too. I don't like the person I once was

oh well la-dee--da Neil. See w00t just has so much more meaning then simply woot. I must go back and edit immediatly :) We went to see Lilo & Stitch after we picked Noel up from drivers ed. It was really cute. There were only like 10 people in the theater. When we got home mom was upset because there was a note from her friend Nevin and his wife at our door. They had been visiting his aunt near us and stopped by on a whim but we were at the movie. Them and their EIGHT KIDS , that is. Mom was really dissapointed, she hasn't seen them in years. I went shopping again today, this is not good. Went to Ulta. I'm in love with Ulta. I want to marry Ulta and have a million of its babies. I, umm, guess I restrained myself. Except...not. I got OPI in First Dance and Pompeii Purple. Pompeii Purple is on right now. I lurve it. I got Neutrogena Moisture Shine Lip Gloss in Glam which was the color used on the model on the cover of July's Lucky. Then I got Jane Fabulizers for Eyes in Suede. I love both of them. I got my hair cut after I went to Ulta. Just trimmed with a couple long layers thrown in there. My hairstylist curled my hair under at the end since it's so very straight. I have to go out and buy a large-barreled curling iron now 'cause I'm loving my hair right now.

I have so much more respect for American Eagle Outfitters now. I wandered in there today and they were playing Kamera by Wilco. I just stood in the middle of the store, amazed. I closed my eyes for a second and I know I looked like a freak but it was the happiest moment of my day to know that some people in that store who might have never picked up a Wilco cd were hearing that song. On the way home I put on Yankee Hotel Foxtrot and told my mom it was the greatest album. She looked at me and asked what was so great about it. Could I possibly be adopted?

Kelley's starting a blog- I'll put the link up soon as I get it. Just watched Chinatown with Noel and Mom. It was really good. I didn't think I would like it but I did. Noel's got me watching a lot of good movies lately. The Conversation was excellent. I've been quoting it all week. "Oh God. Every time I see one of those old guys I think the same thing. I think that he was once somebody's baby boy- it's true I do. I think that he had a mother and a father who loved him and now he's half dead on a park bench and where are his mother and his father and all his uncles now?" Tomorrow night we're watching Doctor Zhivago , my pick not Noel's. Then the night after that we're watching Bandits . Staying up late every night is really doing me in. I almost fell asleep during the end of Chinatown and I'm about to drop right now. Oh and skipping breakfast every day is bad, no?
twop forums back up. All is right with the world

She might have to go through chemo, which like I said is not good for her heart at all. I've only met her once, at Grandma and Grandpa's 50th anniversary last summer, but she's really cool and really nice. For tonight I decided on my black skirt from Express with the layers and a red lace up tee also from Express It'll look nice with my nails. And I think I'm going to go for Stila Convertible Color in Poppy for my lips and cheeks and Stila Eye Glaze in Pearl on my lids. I pledge allegiance to the flag of the United States of America and to the republic for which it stands, one nation, under God, indivisible with liberty and justice for all. whoo go me!

oh no this is bad this is very very bad. The forums are not working at twop at all.It just keeps booting me back to the homepage. If they don't come back soon I'm going to have to kill someone. Stupid servers *grumble grumble* Should I write to Glark? Nah he's probably cranky since the server's being a bad bad boy. I have to go make my bed. Waaaah where are my forums? *sniff*

Katie: it is 1 a.m. you are tired. You have to get up tomorrow. Go to bed. No no- go to bed . Why have I been having problems sleeping lately? I'm really freaked out because for the past week or so somebody has been calling the house and then hanging up. I know someone is there because I can hear them breathing. And when I do go to bed I have twisted dreams like the one below with my cousin morphing into a leprechaun. Counting down the days until high school starts. Woot!

I want to drive away and be free. I want the wind to whip my hair around me, stinging me across the face. I want to sing along to songs I haven't heard in years, songs I thought I never wanted to hear again. I want the sun to soak down on me, to fill me, as I fly away. I want to know that I can always come back, that there will always be a place for me. Someday I will drive away and I will break the confines of this house that is my security and my jail at the same time. It holds me in but one day I will be pushed out into the sunset and I will drive.

I just watched the version of Midsummer Night's Dream that was done a couple years ago with Calista the Stick, Rupert Everett, Michelle Whatsherface and Christian Bale. Mmmmm Christian Bale. Mmmmm. Well anyway...moving on. I liked it (especially Christian Bale), I guess. It was pretty funny. Dad walked out of the room within the first five minutes saying he couldn't follow it. Dad doesn't do Shakespeare, per se. He came back for the play at the end, though. I spent the first half hour of the movie trying to place the guy who later played the woman in the play. Then I finally figured out that he played Pollux Troy in Face/Off . But I just looked at his IMDB Filmography and it wasn't him! And now I can't find who it was because I can't remember his name. I think I might have just recognized him because he looks so much like Pollux. Whatever, did I mention that Christian Bale was in it? Tomorrow Noel and I have to lead the Pledge of Allegiance at this thing for Dad. I haven't decided what I'm going to wear yet. Mom thinks I should wear my pink Ann Taylor dress but that wouldn't go with my Chick Flick Cherry nails so I would have to switch them to Italian Love Affair. Or I could just wear my black dress from Express that I wore to Neil's graduation but I'm not sure if I brought that back from VA.

Did I ever say where I got the name for this blog? It was from Wednesday's BB3 episode where Gerry made an ass of himself and vetoed Marcellas' nomination (whoo go Marcellas!) by saying that his nomination had been racist and prejudiced. He continued to say "I have a black brother-in-law and two beautiful black nephews" to which my brother snarked "I have a sister who is a woman" then Gerry said "Let he who be without sin cast the first stone" (gag me with a sock) and, "My soul is not for sale" Oh Gerry God bless ya for giving a name to my blog but why are you such an idiot?

We met in the dark of night as the city slept. He took me in his arms and we danced as if no one ever had before and no one ever would again. We invented the dance and each step was ours and ours alone. The world could have ended the next day but we would always have the memory of that dance imprinted on our hearts and in the stars above.
What would they say if they knew what I am? Would they laugh? Would they yell? Would they throw things?

I had the strangest dream the other day. It was the first day of school but for some reason we were meeting at the White House. I had my class schedule and I kept walking and walking and I couldn't find my class. I looked into a window on a door and I saw a cookie sitting on a pedastal. I thought that that couldn't be the room so I kept on walking and then I was at the end of the hallway and I still hadn't found the classroom. I opened a door at the end of the hallway and my mom's cousin Randy was there. I started crying and I said I couldn't find my class and I would never be able to get through high school. Randy said he would help me and he morphed into a short little man with a long white beard that brushed the top of his shoes and gnarled twisted hands. We jumped out the window and onto a rainbow that Randy led to a window. I looked in the window and I saw the cookie on the pedastal again. I said that wasn't my class but Randy said it was so I opened the window, climbed in, and sat down at a desk like nothing had happened.

I didn't really listen to any cds today. I miss Neil's cds. I'm listening to the craptastic local pop/rock station here only because when I turned it on Weezer's "Sweater Song" was playing. Tonight I'm going to listen to some Bowie, I think. Noel gave me his burnt copy of "Heroes" because he bought a real copy. I must admit that I only like that song because the title track was used in the Elephant Love Song Medley in Moulin Rouge. Tomorrow Noel and I have to go to this big annual rib fest thing. We hate it. Mom and Dad might take us to Lilo and Stitch- I've heard it's one of the best Disney movies in recent years. I'm a sucker for Disney movies. Alladin and The Little Mermaid can do no wrong. I watched the most boring movie ever tonight- The Way We Were. It was just like a chore to watch. Despite the fact that I hated it I still cried a little at the end. When Hubble (what kind of a name is that anyway?) asked Katie "Is he a good father?" I couldn't help myself. This afternoon I watched Roman Holiday. Absolutely loved it. Audrey Hepburn is a goddess. I have a picture of her and George Peppard in Breakfast At Tiffanys on my wall back home. I talked for a while with Sarah on AIM today- the real Sarah this time. She said that she wants to name her daughter Audrey if she ever has kids. I bought adorable shoes yesterday. I got a pair of Chuck Taylor Converse All Stars in black. I have to head to Hot Topic on Monday to get some cool shoelaces. I also got a super-cute pair of black Nine West cloth flip-flops with kind of a crystal tie back on the strap. And I got some black Nine West heeled loafers (I'm not good at description mmmkay?) to wear to school.

So Neil is evil eeeevillll I say. Yesterday somebody imed me with a sn that I recognized as one of Neil's friends. I thought it was Molly's sn but then the person was all: this is Caitlin. So I had this long conversation with "Caitlin" Then today I asked Neil what Sarah's sn was because I wanted to im her about A Walk To Remember because we had been talking about it. So he gives me this sn and it wasn't the same one that she had imed Noel with. So I said "I thought Sarah's was [insert sarah's real sn] Neil was like "um. that's her old one" so I believed him and I imed the sn he gave me. Yeah it was Molly. And it was Molly pretending to be Caitlin yesterday. I can't be mad at him because it was pretty funny. Maybe I shouldn't be so trustworthy? Ugh I can't sleep. For some reason I ate a Lemon Freeze (read: cup full of sugar) at midnight and now I'm wide awake with nothing to do. I guess it's back to the gwtw fanfic. Wow, I'm pitiful. Does it make you any less pitiful if you can admit to being pitiful?

I know I said I wouldn't post anymore but I lie, get used to it. So I'm going to copy Neil now, since I am, after all, the Female Neil. Kelley is my oldest and best friend. I've known her since, let's see, Mr. Peace's 4th grade Sunday school class. She had just moved to VA from Texas. We hit it right off when I saw that she 1) Had a Nano Baby and 2) Was wearing an American Girl jacket. It was a match made in heaven- we were both huge dorks. She invited me to her house after we had known each other a few weeks and we've been like sisters ever since. Kelley had to move to Oklahoma when we were in 6th grade. Yeah- that sucked dead bunnies through a straw (tm somebody on twop). I missed her so much when she moved- my heart ached for months. I still miss her now but I'm doing better than before. I wish I could visit her in OK but mom won't let me. I wish she would visit me here but she doesn't because want to because I've told her so many times how boring IL is. I know you, Kelley, I know you better than you know yourself so don't think I don't know why you won't visit me. That's okay- I'll always love ya. Now move back to VA already!

on the phone with Grandma. Mom's Aunt has breast cancer- she had an operation the other day (masemectomy or something) and is waiting to hear from her doctor if it was sucessful or if she has to do chemo. Chemo would not be good for her since she has a heart problem

Noel's acting gay. He's wearing my sunglasses and acting like Marcellas from Big Brother. He just hit me- it hurt.

A Brief History Of Life by Katie I was born. I grew up a little and now I'm 14. I told you it would be brief. More? I have two older brothers, Neil who's 18 and Noel who's 16. So I'm the baby of the family- my daddy's princess you could say. Or I say that at least. In the fall I'm going to start high school at a small private school. Neil graduated from there last month and Noel's going to be a junior. I have a weakness for cheesy reality television and I'm obsessed with Gone With the Wind. I also love ER and Trading Spaces. I'll write more later- promise.

But Sarah and Bekah will be around and I'll probably see them at school since Erin and Duke still go there. And I'm going to go shopping with Sarah sometime at Potomac Mills which should be fun. oompah-oompah deedle-deedle-deedle

I had the freakiest dream ever last night. It started out at my Uncle Frank and Aunt Mary's house but only Aunt Mary was there. Hildi from Trading Spaces kept chasing me around the house and I can't remember exactly but I think Mr. Collins might have been there with the youth group that I used to belong to. Then Hildi finally caught me while I was hiding in a closet. She dragged me outside into a car that my Uncle Brad was driving (btw U. Brad is on the opposite side of the family from A. Mary and U. Frank) so he drove me to the Girl Scout camp that I had gone to for two years. On the way there I realized that my duffel bag and my backpack were still at A. Mary's house so U. Brad had to go pick them up. So I was at the camp and I recognized a couple girls from my old church. Then Sarah was there! I don't know why since the camp's in IL but nothing really made sense in the dream so whatever. And with her? This woman who works for the campaign that Mom and Dad have known forever who talks really really loud. So Sarah and Loud Talking Lady said that they would show me to my cabin and that I would be staying with the older girls because I knew Sarah and not with the girls my age (don't ask, I dunno) I say that I'm starved so Sarah says that she'll try to find some food. We're walking down this really dark hallway and in the window there's this Indian guy on a rocking chair writhing around and chanting while people eat. Sarah goes in and comes back morphed into Josh from Big Brother 3. Josh says "There's a crazy guy twisting around in there and doing a hell of a job at it" and then morphs back into Sarah. Sarah and Loud Talking Lady and I walk out of the hallway and they point at this HUGE wasp's nest leaning against a tree. They say that I'll be sleeping there with Sarah and two other girls (at the camp it's always four to a cabin) and then I woke up. Bizarre.

Back home. Aaah home. I love being home. Neil got Johnny Cash Live at Fulsom Prison Johnny: I was in the arms of my best friend's wife [normal talking voice] did I hear someone applaud?" it's great. I read Breakfast at Tiffany's by Truman Capote and Love Story by Erich Segal yesterday. Today I read a couple chapters of Wuthering Heights. I didn't especially feel like reading much and it was kind of odd. Neil's sitting next to me on his computer and it feels odd. Like I'm on the computer at the library or something. I think I need to see Fear Dotcom just because it looks so bad. "It's the last website you'll ever see." Please. We don't have Evian. I might as well be dead.

I love staying up late the night before we drive so that I sleep the whole way there. I think this might be the most perfect night I've had in a long time. I'm so happy and I don't exactly know why. Not that I'm complaining. I love to be insanely happy sometimes.
Reagan is staring at me

This Girl Scout camp song has been running through my head lately. We always sang it at the last campfire on the last night and it was always the last song. OOO, I want to linger OOO, a little longer OOO, a little longer here with you. OOO, it's such a perfect night OOO, it doesn't seem quite right, OOO, that this should be our last with you. OOO, and come September OOO, we will remember, OOO, our camping days and friendships true. OOO, and as the years go by, OOO, I'll think of you and sigh, OOO, this is "good night" and not "good-bye".

Yesterday was fun. We went to this big Fundraiser thing for Dad at some friends' house (Nada and Gordy). They have a hanger attached to their house that the party was in because it rained. Man I miss Robyn. Sometimes I can't even think about it or I'll start crying. I joke around with my mom that I only miss Robyn because of the money I made from babysitting Nolan, Ryan, and Jack but that's just not true. I consider Kelley and Robyn to be the two best friends I've ever had. Robyn was like the cool Aunt that I never had, or that I had in Aunt Kim but was never close enough to do stuff with. We were always doing stuff together. I spent more time in Robyn's van than I did in my own for about a year. I could talk to her about anything and she always told me the truth- she didn't pull all that crap that a lot of people do. She's the most outspoken person I've ever known and I love her for that... even though it can be embarrasing sometimes. I think one of the reasons I love her so much is because she's Mom's polar opposite. I love Mom, don't get me wrong, but it was nice to have both of them. Is it strange that one of my best friends is 30-something and has three sons?

You can learn lots of stuff you never knew about people by reading their blogs. Such as that John likes Mitch Hedburg. I love Mitch Hedburg! Today was just really great. Really really great. It started off a bit blah as I had to drag myself out of bed and to school. Then I found out that I had flunked a History quiz after I took a History test but I think I did a lot better on the test. Dr. V's really nice. He went around the room during the test and gave us all Hershey Kisses. It was just a really nice little thing. Then after the test we went out and drew maps on the parking lot with chalk of Southeast Asia. Our group won. Go us! So at lunch I'm sitting with, among other people, Anna Frodghy and Lindsey. Anna spontaneously decides that we should roll around on the chalk maps. We had nothing better to do so the three of us just started rolling around. We ended up with multi-colored chalk all. over. us. It was such a blast. Then of course we had to run around hugging people against their will so that they would get chalk on them. Meanwhile Catherine thinks we're total freaks and keeps saying that we're going to get sent home. So then we had to go into school since lunch was over. I saw Mrs. K first and she just kind of stared at me as her jaw dropped. All the girls immediatly screeched "What happened to you?" to which I responded, "Explosion down at the old chalk factory" and walked away as if everything was normal. My first class after lunch was Geometry and Mrs. C just asked if I had had a run-in with the chalkboard. I eventually had to run into Mrs. G (the principal) and all she did was stare at me and ask what in the world had happened. I told her the truth, and she thought it was kind of funny. It was just a really nice day.

So today was my first day of school. Ever. And it was pretty good, dare I say great. There are a lot of new teachers this year. I have the same teacher for English, Bible and Speech. I wasn't originally going to be in Speech, I wanted a study hall in that period. It was going to be nice, too, since Noel has a study hall then and so do Lindsey and Katherine. But apparently Freshman can't have study halls, I really don't understand that. So they stuck me in Speech, which wasn't what I wanted but I was happy that I wasn't in Art 1. I think Speech is going to be pretty good, actually. My Science teacher, who's also new, is super-smart. She has a phd from Stanford, and used to study volcanoes and stuff. Pretty cool. My Spanish teacher is really funny. I think I'm going to like Spanish a lot.

I'm going to school tomorrow. I'm going to wake up in the morning and put on my uniform and go to school. I'm going to get a locker and I'm going to put pictures of Goran Visnjic in it. I'm going to sit in a desk. I'm going to take notes. I'm almost crying here I'm so happy. I can't honestly remember a time when I was happier than this. I miss Neil, though. It's strange- we all miss him but we've fallen back in step with our lives and it's like this was the way it always was. Noel and I are a lot closer than before, I think. Of course he'll probably read this and say it's complete crap. But we haven't had a fight since... I can't even remember when. On Dateline tonight they were having a thing about Fligt 93. At the end they just showed pictures of everyone who had been on the flight. Before I knew it I was crying. I just thought about all the people I know who might've died if it hadn't been for the people on that flight. Neil- I'm so nervous for you. How'd the audition go? Call me tomorrow, k?

Bangkok (dpa) - Hungry monkeys have invaded a village in northeastern Thailand, breaking into homes, stealing food and biting the village headman, provincial officials said Monday. Virat Boontod, a provincial administration official in Yasothon province, said about 500 pig-tailed monkeys had been making frequent raids on Taohai village, 430 kilometres northeast of Bangkok, because there was not enough food in the jungle during the current dry season. He said the monkeys managed to get inside many homes through windows or by scratching holes in villagers' roofs. ``They steal chicken and duck eggs and any other food they can find,'' Virat said in a telephone interview. ``Now the villagers are getting fed up with the monkeys. Some of them are using slingshots to drive them away.'' He said one big domesticated monkey was pressed into service to guard an entrance to the village, but it was outnumbered by the simian invaders, who found other ways in. Last week the village's leader was bitten in the thigh by one of the invaders and had to get rabies shots. ``The hungry monkeys get some food from local (Buddhist) temples, but it's not enough,'' Virat said. ``We're going to ask for food donations to feed them and we'll ask the district administration to provide a budget for them.''

John- I'm gonna defer to Neil because he says it so much better than I ever could. I'm not dissing John Mayer for being a guy with his guitar and mad affection for his girl. I think he's an awesome guitarist. But his music is not innovative and his lyrics are played. The Grammys should be about pushing the boundaries and being innovative. John Mayer does neither of these. Avril Lavigne is most definitely controlled by her record company. She's the biggest poser on the music scene today. And she can't perform live worth crap. And I really do not hate popular music just because it's popular. In fact I don't even hate popular music. Just some. I totally agree with you on one thing though, John. The Clash tribute was great. Even though I had to put aside my Bruce Springsteen dislike to enjoy it. But that's a whole 'nother story :) And I completely respect that people have their own personal music tastes and not everyone should be happy. But the NARAS should judge on innovation, and who's pushing the boundaries- not whose albums fly off the shelfs. And sure, some music does get very very popular because it's good. But as I've said Yankee Hotel Foxtrot was a favorite of a huge amount of music critics, who probably know a lot more about music then the general populace (though admittedly there are some critics who don't know what the crap they're talking about) I don't even care that much if YHF was nominated for the top prize- but Jim O'Rourke should have been nominated for producing that album, because he's at the top of his game.

I wish NARAS would stop pretending they judge art over sales. The Grammys are a sham and it's ridiculous that Yankee Hotel Foxtrot wasn't even nominated. Avril Lavigne? Go away. Please. John Mayer? As they said on the radio today: Art Garfunkel has more testosterone than you. Seeing Simon and Garfunkel together for the first time in over 20 years was awesome, totally the highlight of the show even if they did both look uncomfortable. Ugh, gotta go to school now in the first time in over a week. Blah.

Today has been pretty depressing so far. Dad's back in Illinois and he found R.D.'s body there, next to the house in an old hole he'd been digging for years. It's relieving in a way, because now we know that he died peacefully. But I still had some small sense of hope that he really wasn't dead this whole time.

Let his comments speak for themselves! Do not create your own! Do not make videos with them! You dirty infidels. Seriously, though. I'm sick of seeing al-Sahaf everywhere. Spring break has started! Yay. I need this break so much right now. I can't count the number of times I've fallen asleep in class this week. I'm not planning on doing anything much over break. I have a couple books I want to read. The Shipping News, Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man, Absalom Absalom, and a book Mrs. K lent me called My Family and Other Animals. I thought it was a mistake :)

Hasn't been a very good week so far. I'm tired all the time, I don't feel well, I wish school would just end already, my grades are slipping, I'm homesick, and all these things are just making me have a really short temper with everyone around me. If I snap at any of you sometime in the near future, please forgive me. I wish I could solve all my friends' problems. I feel so helpless sometimes.
I've developed a twitch in my right eye. You can't barely see it, but I can feel it. Mighty annoying.

The game was fun beyond all reckoning. Most fun I've had in a long, long time. I spent the whole tailgate party trying to sell candy with George, Kirsten, and Amanda by means of propaganda. Buy Snickers Crunchers and support third world countries! The actual game was a blast. It's the only game of the year when we're allowed to be horrible sportspeople and trashtalk the faculty. Oh my gosh I'm at the Pad. It's 2 L337 2 Quit. I'm getting ready to own everybody at CS.

Happy Birthday to me. w00t. I'm officially 15 so I can do.....basically nothing. I'm about to head out to see Finding Nemo with a bunch of friends. Then tonight I'm going to go see Chicago at the National Theater with Neil, Noel, and Nicole. Missions Trip was grand. I had mucho fun. We spent the majority of the week drywalling and putting up siding and clearing out this old lady's backyard/garbage heap for 30 years. Found some interesting things back there. Me and Mr. Noyes bonded over the week. He's a pretty cool guy I guess. Had some strange experiences with him, including listening to the Undercover Brother soundtrack together and having numerous ABBA sing-a-longs. Who would've thought he would be an ABBA fan?

Oh my gosh, this has been a long weekend. About to head off on my trip down to Psalm 23 Camp in West VA. w00t. School's over! It really hasn't sunk in yet at all. Too tired to write more. Must. Sleep.

Oh my gosh, I'm dying. I'm so sick and I can't take school off because it's finals week. I think I'm either going to throw up or fall asleep during my exams. In better news, Dr. Vanderpoel liked my research paper. Awoogah-ah-ah! We got our yearbooks yesterday. I look yearbook BS, it's the funniest stuff in the world. The description of the Freshman class says something like "The Freshman love to think outside the box, evidenced by the songs that Freshman Katie Manzullo makes up about the workings of our school." Now that would be funny even if I did do that, but I never have! Hee! Oh yeah, and there's the worst picture of me ever on the Homecoming page. Not only do I look terrible but I'm also doing the waltz with George that we made up so I look like a bafoon. Good times, good times. I'm also featured in the part about Speech, cracking up when we're all supposed to be serious. In other news, I'm going to fail all of my finals with flying colors. Probably won't be blogging for a while. Finals week --> All day party at Dr. Vanderpoel's --> Sleeping all day Saturday --> Week long missions trip in West Virginia starting on Sunday Missions trip is gonna be fun. McGehee and I convinced Sr. Noyes to put us in the same work group. And we're riding the whole way down there and back up in his car. Oh my gosh, he's gonna go insane. That poor, poor man.

Yeah, so I uhhh haven't posted in a long time. Sorry 'bout that. School is insanely busy. But there's only two more weeks left! Bling bling! Yesterday was pretty close to perfect. Went to the National Gallery of Art theater with Neil, Noel, and Nicole and met Matt White there. Bling bling. Haven't seen him since he got shipped off to rehab in January. Darn that rehab, by the way. Anywho! Saw the 1926 version of Faust which was surprisingly funny. There was a live musical score to go with it. Very, very cool. I feel like I gained lots of cultured points for this week. After the movie we all went out for Pho then went home. Neil and Nicole headed out for Elise's house so me and Noel and Matt hung out until his mom picked him up. Seeing him was most cool. I've really missed him. Note to parents: DON'T SEND YOUR KIDS TO REHAB! Especially for an "Unhealthy interest in pop culture" Hehe. So I actually wrote my History paper today. Bow down before me all you nay-sayers! Everbody go see Faust. I'll respect you and you'll be better people

It's official, school's been delayed 13 days. Instead of starting on the 2nd we're starting on the 15th now. I'm not really sure how I feel about this. I'm really anxious to start new classes. Also, this might mean more time in Illinois, which is pretty good actually. I love being here, it's so incredibly peaceful.

School's going to be so weird next year. Five of my best friends are leaving (whether they wanted to or not) and we're going to be in the new building with all the middle schoolers and elementary kids. Plus, for the first half of the year, we're all going to be in the same wing. It's going to be crazy and I just hope I don't completely hate it. I've really loved being at Providence, it feels a lot more like a really small family there. I'm afraid that we're going to be under a lot more restriction, too. Because Mrs. G was always a really cool principal who let us get away with a lot. But now it's not just her pushing rules and punishments on us- there's going to be Dr. B and Dr. W. And the upper school is probably going to have the most rules because we have to "set the example" for the other kids. Blech.

We're going back to Illinois on Saturday. w00t!! And no, that's not a sarcastic w00t. I haven't been to Illionis in a year and I miss it. I'm getting sick of Virginia in the summer. I feel so stifled! En otras noticias, we got surround sound. It's soooo dang L337!

I'm darn bored. Today I almost started doing the Math packet for Algebra 2. Yeah, the one I don't have to do until September. Tonight should be fun, though. We (family + Nicole) are going to the Congressional Baseball Game in DC. We've never been but I've heard it's a lot of fun. Our friends the Terrys, who used to live in our neighborhood and who I used to babysit for, are going to be there. I've only seen them once since they moved back to Omaha. Yay for DVD Rips! I'm currently watching Chicago. So dang L337 Yesterday- 4th of July in DC. Went up to the Capitol with Neil, Noel, Mom, Nicole, Courtney, Courtney's friend Rachel, Sarah, Sam, and the Long's French exchange student Violette. Neil gave a tour. He's pretty good at it. Then we weaseled our way into the VIP seating section for the concert in front of the Capitol. Yay for Dolly Parton. The fireworks started right at the end of the concert. Surprisingly, the fireworks in Rockford are longer and better. Worst part of the day was by far the Metro ride home. There were so many people cramming into the train, it was like a stampede. First all 10 of us managed to cram into a train. I've never smelled so much collective B.O. in all my life. Very groddy. But then it turned out that the dang train was our of service. So we had to fit an entire trainload of people back onto the platform. Then all of us except Neil and Sarah got onto the next train. It was pretty bad. All in all, I realized that Fourth of July in Illinois isn't all that bad after all.

Great article in the Post today. I couldn't find it online, but it's near the end of the Style section. It's about this old curmudgeon in Oregon who never married and lived on this ancient rundown farm in Oregon and shunned all of his neighbors. He never threw anything away, and when he died they found his old childhood toys around his bedroom. Well anyway, starting in the 60's, kids would bother him (think Boo Radley) and he would chase them off with his shotgun. And when he died, they found out that he was really rich. He had amassed a fortune of about 11 Million. He left all of it to the city so that they could build a youth park on his farm! It was a pretty entertaining article. And that's why I love the Post

Why do my friends have the social skills of simians who've been kept in captivity their entire lives? I wish I was back in Illinois. I wish I was back in Illinois. I wish I went to a different school. Why can't people learn what you should tell your friends and what you shouldn't? And why can't I do anything without the whole school knowing? All I want is just one completely nice day with my friends that isn't ruined. And now I think I'm going to throw up.

Sorry for all my asinine posts. I'm so happy- I have a babysitting job tomorrow. I'm absolutely flat broke right now so that's good news. We went to the Anderson's Lake Geneva house yesterday. They're extraordinarily nice people and good friends of ours. Their house up there is gorgeous. They're right on the lake and the decorating job is fabulous. We got up there at about 1:30, talked for a while on the porch (which has a great view of the lake) and then went tubing. I lurve tubing. Then we came back and had the Great Anderson/Manzullo Croquet Tournament. What I learned: Manzullos don't aim. For dinner they had a chef come in and cook for us. He's a really nice guy and the food was great. The girl who works for him was coaxed into singing for us by Mr. Anderson. Wow. She has such a good voice. I was very impressed. Before we left we watched a movie in their home theater and looked at their daughter's wedding pictures in the "gift-wrapping room" (which really serves a lot more purposes) So I've made the decision that I want to move to Lake Geneva.

Biology=worst class ever. I'm trying to convince Mrs. G to let me drop it and take Bio at home with mom, who was actually a Biology major in college. Only problem is, the other classes then are English 11, Government 12, and History 9 and I'm not allowed to have a study hall. So, if I can drop the class, then I'm either going to beg for a study hall or beg to be Dr. Vanderpoel's Teacher Aide or something. Matt White's going to be Mrs. D's teacher aide in Art 1 so he can get out of PE. I would be so much happier at school if I could only get out of Biology, so everybody cross their fingers for me plz!

I pinpointed precisely what I don't like about the new building: there's nowhere I can go to be alone. So, I'll just have to create a place. I'm thinking hidden passage, I'm thinking of building a ladder to the roof. :)

Ick. I just hauled a bucket of nasty old stagnant pond water from the disgusting "pond" behind our house and then dumped it in the back of our toilets. And now I smell like nasty old stagnant pond water.
So I just used up my family's water supply by washing my face and hair and brushing my teeth...

Well, we came out of Isabel unscathed except for the fact that we now have no water except for a little tiny bit in the basement bathroom. We kept electricity all through last night (it might have gone off when I was sleeping though) but the water supply doesn't have power, so there's no water for Fairfax County. Yesterday afternoon, before the storm came, I told Dad that we should fill up the bathtub in case we lost water. He told me very firmly that we wouldn't lose water.... Bet he wishes we had that bathtub full now.
Hmm, no school tomorrow. That's cool I guess...I actually kind of felt like going to school.

The first day of school was a shocker, I'll admit. But now I'm starting to settle into a groove and I'm starting to dig school. Yearbook is going to be grand I think. Art 1 will be okay even though I don't have an artistic bone in my body. Algebra 2 is boring beyond all belief, but I love Mommy Case. Well, time to babysit for a new family. They actually have a girl. I never get to babysit girls!

Oy vey. School was an extraordinarily tiring experience. There's a lot of changes. A lot. But I like most of my classes (I'm vary wary about Biology), the Drama teacher is a nut like all good drama teachers should be, and MATT WHITE'S BACK! Yay! The carpool is very stressful, but that'll all get worked out eventually. Driving in with Duke is L337 as always. Noel is in two of my classes, bling bling. I'm doing Yearbook, bling bling. I never knew how tiring the new schedule would be. Not only is school 45 minutes longer, but lunch is twenty minutes shorter. And there's not even a couch anywhere where I can crash for a minute or two. And that's all I can muster right now. Bed time for Katie....at 9:30....that's a first.
Oh my gosh I just used the word "yom" in my Scrabble game and it made me win. Thank you, Dr. Vanderpoel!

I am so incredibly excited about school starting. I just am ignoring all my apprehensions, and expecting an awesome year. I love most of my teachers (the other ones I don't know), I'm looking forward to my classes, the new building is going to be really nice. I'm so happy!
i'm trying to be positive about school, i'm really really trying.

Funeral Blues Stop all the clocks, cut off the telephone, Prevent the dog from barking with a juicy bone, Silence the pianos and with muffled drum Bring out the coffin, let the mourners come. Let aeroplanes circle moaning overhead Scribbling on the sky the message He Is Dead, Put crepe bows round the white necks of the public doves, Let the traffic policemen wear black cotton gloves. He was my North, my South, my East and West, My working week and my Sunday rest, My noon, my midnight, my talk, my song; I thought that love would last for ever; I was wrong. The stars are not wanted now: put out every one; Pack up the moon and dismantle the sun; Pour away the ocean and sweep up the wood, For nothing now can ever come to any good. W. H. Auden

I just can't really imagine spending two more years in high school. If this doesn't work out somehow, I don't know how I'll do it.

In case you haven't read it on Neil's blog, I'm planning on skipping my Junior year. I have my parents on board, I just need to talk to Mrs. Gossard about it. We looked at the Graduation requirements, and figured out that all I have to do is take an English course and a History course through Texas Tech (which is what Erin did) So next year, I'll take Chemistry with my current class, World Lit. with the Seniors, The Christian Way with the Seniors, and a history class (it doesn't really matter which one I take correspondance and which I do at Trinity) Plus I'll do Yearbook again, and play soccer this year and next year, and an at home PE. All of those classes leaves me with two free periods next year for electives or Trig. I'm going to apply to Grove City, which would put me and Neil (plus Allan, Nick, Beth, Tallie, Jeff, Etc.) there for a year together. I was originally planning on applying to University of Illinois too, but the parents only agreed to the plan if I go to a Christian college. I'm meeting with Mrs. Gossard sometime this week, so everybody send me good vibes that she'll agree.

In fact Mom is probably the only one who'll ever use it since she ended up with three kids who share none of her interests. We don't play piano, we don't like Biology. That poor woman.

Over break I've realized that I can no longer read. There's something wrong with my eyes, I'm convinced. I've never been to an optometrist in my life and I always got the chart right at the doctor's. But when I try to read my eyes unfocus or something and it gets all blurry. I used to be able to semi-speed read by reading phrases or sentences by themselves instead of just word by word but I can't do it anymore. So I've resorted to slowly reading the Cliffs Notes on Le Morte D'Arthur and watching hours upon hours of Buffy every day. Yesterday I watched two hours from seven to nine in the morning ("Ted" and "Bad Eggs"), then one on tape around two ("Hushed"), and then two more hours from four to six in the evening ("Surprise" and "Innocence"). And today, since there's not an episode on until eleven, I downloaded the last episode of the series, "Chosen", and watched it twice. I'm going to start taping the ones that are on when I'm in school and then watching them and the two in the evening in a four-hour long Buffy Mini Marathon while I do my homework. It's a good thing.

Thanksgiving at Mom's uncle's house. The Prep School/Ivy League section of the family who we see once or twice a year. Which translates to uncomfortable hugs, a general lack of in-jokes, and large-scale debates on gay civil unions, etc. Plus our biannual literature discussion with our cool second cousin, Jane. The Ivy Leaguers are pretty leet, especially urlLink Derek . It was a Multinational celebration, as our other cousin Lee brought a Canadian friend and two Dutch friends. Uncle Milan quote of the year: (to Dad concerning Mom)"If you ever abuse her or neglect her in any way I'll be on you like hell"

The other day, Mom suggested that Noel and I enter a songwriting contest since we "think [we]'re so poetic" But this isn't just any songwriting contest. Oh, no. This is the American Dreams songwriting contest, sponsered by Hillary Duff. And if you win you get to appear on NBC's American Dreams . Yeah, we shot that idea down. It's Thanksgiving morning, so I'm in front of the tv watching the parade as I have every other Thanksgiving of my life. This parade always kicks off the holiday spirit and all that good stuff for me. Amongst the soap opera stars and Bedazzled� drill teams I find comfort in the fact that, in fifteen years, nothing has really changed. I'm not that different from the little girl with bald patches (yay for urlLink trichotillomania ) and no front teeth who sat on the floor in Illinois watching the same floats and the same balloons.

So, new design. Still needs to be tweaked around with. What do you think? We had Fake Thanksgiving last night with Nicole and Joe Farley. I feel sorry for Joe, he had to take our Christmas card picture half an hour after meeting us. So far I've had a thoroughly unproductive break. I'd promised myself that I'd have Sir Thomas Malory's Le Morte D'Arthur finished by next Monday, but I haven't cracked it open for a week. Happy Thanksgiving, everybody. And Happy Birthday, Neil!

I'm looking forward to a long, long (long) day (7:30-4ish) of selling food stuffs to parents at parent/teacher conferences while the rest of my school slumbers. Ah, the joys and kickbacks of Senate life.

Okay, so I have really good news and really bad news. I'll go chronologically and give you the really bad news first. I had my meeting with Mrs. Gossard and it doesn't look good. They have a new policy that they just came up with this summer that you can only graduate early if you have perfect grades in every subject and all this other stuff. I don't know if I really want to pursue this now, I'm not big on the idea of fighting administration. So, more on this later. But then came the really good news! We had our speeches for Student Senate on Friday, and then everyone voted and they announced the winner at the end of the day. And I won!! It was so nerve-wracking, I was the last name announced. I felt like I was nervous when I gave my speech and that my voice shook, but everybody (including my Speech class commrades) told me that I did really good. There were twelve people running for four seats, and I was the only sophmore to win. So the Senate is Colin (who's the president), Jennifer Green, Vandy, Matt Hayre, and me. This week was very up and down, but it ended well. Yesterday after school, George and I went trick-or-treating dressed up like Viet Cong. Most excellent. And now I have a bunch of great books to read over the weekend (Collected Sonnets of Edna St. Vincent Millay, a biography of Zelda Fitzgerald, East of Eden) Times are (mostly) good.

Last night, went back to the Christmas Eve's of my childhood- Uncle Frank's house. Highlights included when Santa (aka our cousin Joe Tarquini) visited. He gave our cousin Anna a Care Bear, our cousin Joey a toy car, and our NonRelative Amanda a Mike's Hard Lemonade. My Nana started an antique doll collection for me, Mom, my cousin Mary Kay, and my aunt Mary a long time ago. She bought tons of dolls for us and had them stockpiled in her house. We would all get one every Christmas Eve. Though she died several years ago, there were still a few dolls left over. Last night I opened the last one, ever. And I realized that, though Nana and I were never really close, I miss her so much I can't even express it. And it's not that I miss the times we had together, I miss what we could have had. I miss what Mary Kay had with her. Well, today we're going to our grandparent's house to see Mom's side of the family. Everyone will be there except for her brother and his family who live in Arizona. This'll be grand, I'm sure, since I love my cousins. Merry Christmas, guys. I love you all.

Trinity makes no sense whatsoever. We're not allowed to put anything Santa-related on our lockers for the Xmas Locker Decoration contest, and yet we can wear santa hats tomorrow for Holiday Dress Day...... I just don't get it.

So Christmas is around the corner, which has me thinking of all those fabulous Manzullo Family Christmas Memories. I feel like every Christmas has been the same (with the exception of last year) ever since we grew up and stopped believing in Santa. And I wouldn't have it any other way. Last year opened my eyes to the fact that I like my Christmas traditions, and I missed them greatly. I was trying to remember a minute ago when I really stopped believing in Santa. My parents had always told me that he was dead (thanks a lot, parents!), which clearly scarred me for life, but I still managed to believe. I think that it really ended the year Neil and Noel discovered Mom's terrible hiding spot for the presents. She always did wonder why they weren't surprised about the Playstation. So, when did y'all stop believing?

LAS VEGAS - Pop star Britney Spears married a childhood friend from Louisiana in an early morning ceremony, but quickly arranged to have it annulled, a source close to Spears told The Associated Press Sunday. George Maloof Jr., owner and operator of the Palms Casino Hotel, confirmed that the 22-year-old singer married Jason Allen Alexander about 5:30 a.m. at a Las Vegas wedding chapel. "Nobody knew it was coming," said Maloof, Spears' good friend. A source speaking on condition of anonymity told The Associated Press that Spears was a "little stunned" about getting married to Alexander but was not drunk at the time. The source said the two arranged an annulment Saturday afternoon in the presence of several people, including a Las Vegas lawyer. The signed annulment will be official when the courts open Monday morning, the source said.

And now I shall enlight you about the recent goings-on at TCS. The Great Huzzah War of Spring 2004. It all began many a week ago when the Junior Bible class (under the command of one Dr. Vanderpoel) took to interrupting the Sophomore Bible class (valiantly led by Mr. Pridmore) with cries of "Huzzah!" from across the hall. These vocal outbursts soon escalated and they began marching into our room and giving half-hearted Huzzahs. The Sophomores, never ones to sit idly by, responded by constructing an arc (of the covenant variety) out of a cardboard box as well as various and sundry odds and ends. The lovely thing is adorned with a pipe cleaner archangel and bears the countenances of the two dueling Bible teachers on either side. We marched around the Junior's Bible room 7 times, blew a trumpet three times and gave a hearty "Huzzah!" The above event transpired last Friday. This Monday a special delivery was made by Mrs. Smith. It seems a rogue group of rebels had stolen our arc. Included in our delivery was a picture of the entire Junior class around the arc with bandanas or History books over their faces. And Dr. Vanderpoel holding that day's Washington Post. Also, a ransom note demanding Hostess products, M&Ms (orange only) and Dr. Pepper. If the ransom was not paid by 8:10 A.M. today the rebels sincerely hoped that our "pagan box" could swim. The Sophomores unanimously decided that we would not deal with terrorists. We quickly found the arc in Mrs. Gossard's office and took it back on Thursday. It was safely (!) hidden in Mr. Pridmore's truck. However, that same day, Dr. Vanderpoel combed the entire school and the surrounding area and re-stole the arc! Due to a series of events that cannot be disclosed here in the interests of Sophomore Security, we reclaimed our arc. The juniors are now the proud owners of: 1 picture of the Sophomore class consuming Hostess products, M&Ms and Dr. Pepper while holding our arc,1 box of empty Hostess wrappers and boxes. They received these wonderful items during a ceremony involving another lap round the room with our precious arc. The pictures are phenomenal and I'll do my darndest to get them on here at some point. For now we wait, and plot. And learn about the New Testament of course.

Well it's back to school tomorrow for me and the rest of the TCS posse. Break has been grand and I can feel summer approaching ever-so-rapidly. It won't be long now. And then I can be an upperclass(wo)man! That's exciting, I guess. Happy Easter, my lovelies.

Break continues to be most excellent. George and Drew are back! Yay! Two days ago, hung out with 'Manda my dear all day. Joyous. Then yesterday I went in to the city with 'Manda and her mom. We saw the Beatles' exhibit at American History and urlLink Douglas Gordon at the Hirshhorn. George came over after dinner and we attempted to watch Something's Got To Give with the parentals but it was pretty awful. So we went for a walk but my parents thought we were just in the gazebo. We were sitting on a park bench talking when my dad goes by in our van! Search party...nice. But they aren't mad or anything so George is still allowed in the house :) I watched the latest episode of The Apprentice twice. Oh my goodness. This, my friends, is great television. Best. Reality Show. Ever.
Shopping, shopping, shopping! This in tan. These. This. And these in green. I already have them in red and they are the. most. comfortable. pants. ever.

I went to a Bob Dylan concert last night with Neil, Noel, Mom, Duke, Hayre, Matt White, Sally, Larissa, Lynzi, and Mr. and Mrs. White. It was so awesome. Oh my goodness. urlLink There's a set list here. The best part of the show would have to be the second encore when a group of people by us lit up. High hilarity. It was the perfect start to Easter Break. Today we went to see my cousin Tom's marching band at Arlington National Cemetary. It was really windy which resulted in about half the music being carried off with the wind. But they were still good. Should be a grand week. Only downside is that my best friend is gone. I'm so sorry, George and Drew.
One more day until spring break!!

School's out for summer School's out forever School's been blown to pieces I finished up exams on Thursday, after which I went to a Sophomore (now Junior!) party at Aly's house. Many good times resulted including George falling flat on his face multiple times, seranading a bag boy with "A Mighty Fortress is Our God", Alex proposing to a cashier, and singing "Happy Birthday" to a police man, and Spencer grinding his feet into my head yelling "Buy a new couch!" So I spent the night there with Amanda, Laura Jones, Aly and Kathy and went to school the next morning for the final chapel/awards ceremony. I got the ybk staffer of the year award! My grand prize? 52 ounces of Slurpee goodness! So that was really really cool. Then I went out to Wendy's with a bunch of the Seniors err "graduates." I'm not gonna get used to calling them that. And the girls' lock-in was last night. Very fun. Would've been better if some certain people had showed up. Anywho- the summer's here and I can barely believe it. My aunt Kim and her family (all six of them) are coming to visit for a while on Monday. I'm kind of wondering how they'll all fit.. Well, back to sleep.
